author: The Herald
title: The Herald - Breaking news.
text: Tanganda invests in solar plants to cut energy costs Nelson Gahadza Senior Business Reporter Tanganda Tea Company says investments in green energy have mitigated the impact of limited power supply from the national grid and reduced diesel consumption by standby generators. The company has invested in green energy through the installation of three independent battery-supported solar energy plants at three of its five estates. The total maximum production capacity of the three plants is 4,4 megawatts (MW), made up of Ratelshoek Estate generating 1,8 MW, Jersey Estate generating 1,4 MW, and Tingamira Estate generating 1,2 MW. “Our strategy is to tie the solar plants to the national grid on a net metering arrangement in order to facilitate full utilisation of generated power and to reduce the cost of power when the company draws from banked units when solar power is not available for use,” the company said in its 2023 annual report. The company said that in terms of energy consumption, it used 1 003 288 litres of diesel and 261 130 litres of petrol during the year, which are non-renewable resources. “Energy consumed from renewable sources was 21 039 cubic metres of firewood and PV solar 2 396 897 kWh. Electricity supplied by Zimbabwe Electricity Transmission and Distribution Company amounting to 7 693 471 kWh was also consumed. “Work is underway within the national power utility to set policy to determine and provide the breakdown of power supplied into renewable and non-renewable energy,” the company said. Overall, fuel usage was lower than the previous year, with diesel usage going down by 17,69 percent from last year following a decrease in the usage of generators to power factories, while petrol usage went down by 28,45 percent due to the reduction in fuel consumed by hand-held plucking machines. The Zimbabwe Energy Regulatory Authority (ZERA) says there has been increased investment in renewable energy by independent power producers (IPPs), mainly for their consumption, to offset the adverse impact of erratic power supplies. By harnessing the power of the sun for solar energy, businesses are tapping into a sustainable and renewable energy source, reducing reliance on conventional power systems, especially hydro, which is also prone to the effects of the El Nino weather phenomenon. According to the Zimbabwe Energy Regulatory Authority (ZERA), the majority of energy investments are now in solar energy, with some thermal, mainly in the mining sector. ZERA said the most successful projects are the ones funded by private companies, and in most cases, they are produced for their consumption. Agricultural companies have also significantly made investments in alternative energy sources, and irrigation facilities have been identified as key for agriculture firms. Alternative renewable energy sources reduce over-reliance on hydropower, whose supplies are already unreliable for businesses, weighing on their productivity.

author: Campo Grande News
title: Fiéis lotam santuário para celebrar Missa de Lava-Pés em Campo Grande - Comportamento - Campo Grande News
text: Fiéis lotam santuário para celebrar Missa de Lava-Pés em Campo Grande Cerca de 600 pessoas participaram da festa cristã na noite desta quinta-feira (28) Cerca de 600 pessoas estiveram no Santuário Nossa Senhora do Perpétuo Socorro, situado na Avenida Afonso Pena, para celebrar o início do Tríduo Pascal durante a noite desta quinta-feira (28). Em Campo Grande, um grupo de fieis participaram do ritual de lava-pés, assim como a ceia cristã - onde Jesus lavou os pés dos 12 discípulos em sinal de humildade, e instituiu a Eucaristia, o corpo e o sangue de Cristo. Padre Reginaldo Padilha, responsável pela paróquia, relatou à reportagem que o momento é de demonstrar amor e solidariedade. "Jesus quis mostrar à comunidade o sentido do amor e do serviço e nós fizemos este ritual para mostrar à comunidade que, quando nos dispomos a servir, começamos com um gesto singelo, como lavar os pés uns dos outros". Ainda segundo o sacerdote, esta foi a oportunidade para reflexão sobre a fé diante a sociedade. "Fico pensando se cada família tivesse a oportunidade de celebrar o lava-pés em sua própria casa, não haveria tanta dificuldade. Hoje, muitas famílias estão brigadas, discutindo por coisas inúteis e fúteis. No domingo de Páscoa, que deveria ser para agregar, reunir e celebrar, muitas famílias não terão isso porque uma está com ódio da outra, estão brigadas. Então, o gesto do lava-pés mostra justamente esse amor". De acordo com a estudante Lara Rosa, de 19 anos, a Eucaristia é instituída como um alimento precioso, e simboliza o pão dado por amor. Acompanhada de duas amigas, ela acompanhou a celebração com sentimento de compaixão e gratidão. "[...] Esse ato representa tudo o que ele passou e sofreu por nós. O ato dele, de lavar os pés, mostra o que ele fez e o quanto falta de amor, humildade e compreensão em nós" Já o eletricista Giorgio Eurico Santana Alves, 44 de idade, presenciou a missa ao lado da esposa, a nutricionista Solange Yamamoto, de 40 anos, e do filho, Gabriel, 4. "Estamos desde ontem explicando como funciona a missa e a Semana Santa", disse. "Nós ensinamos que não é só coelhinho da Páscoa para ele. Isso mostra o quanto Jesus foi humilde. Mostra que temos que ter uma compaixão com próximo", comentou. André Ricardo Rodrigues dos Santos, de 46 anos, disse ao Campo Grande News que frequenta a igreja desde criança. Começou a vir com a mãe. Já foi coroinha, participou de grupo jovem e eventos de caridade. "É um ato simbólico, muito bonito e deixado por Jesus. Mostra a humildade dele, mesmo sendo quem é. Um exemplo para todos nós", finalizou. A programação no Santuário continua nesta sexta-feira (29). A celebração se inicia às 5h30 com adoração ao Santíssimo Sacramento. Às 15h, haverá a celebração da Paixão do Senhor, seguido por Veneração da imagem do Cristo Morto às 16h30, Via-Sacra e Canto do Perdão às 19h. A missa do Sábado Santo será às 19h, com Vigília Pascal na Noite Santa. O Domingo de Páscoa na Ressurreição do Senhor terá missa às 7h, 10h, 16h, 18h e 20h. Às 17h, a programação é de Cantata de Páscoa. Confira a galeria de imagens: Receba as principais notícias do Estado pelo celular. Clique aqui para acessar o canal do Campo Grande News no WhatsApp e siga nossas redes sociais .

author: @waff48
title: Hot, hazy, poor air quality and scattered storms Friday
text: Hot, hazy, poor air quality and scattered storms Friday 48 First Alert Weather Day HUNTSVILLE, Ala. ( [WAFF](http://www.waff.com/)) - Good morning and happy Friday. Fair skies are overhead with warm morning temperatures in the upper 70s, some areas of patchy fog have developed overnight. Today is a 48 First Alert Weather Day for poor air quality across the Tennessee Valley due to Saharan Dust. People with respiratory sensitivity may experience difficulty breathing, especially with the hot and humid conditions. A Heat Advisory is in effect for most counties through 7:00 PM, heat index values will range from 100 to 107 degrees during the afternoon. It will be a hazy, hot and humid day across the Tennessee Valley before a cold front sweeps through. This weak front will trigger some scattered showers and thunderstorms during the afternoon and evening. Some storms will be stronger in nature with isolated damaging wind gusts, frequent lightning and locally heavy rainfall. Storms will end by late evening as the front drops off to the southeast leaving mainly clear skies and warm morning lows in the lower 70s. The weekend forecast looks pretty nice for any outside plans with just isolated showers and storms popping up on Saturday, mainly during the afternoon. Sunday will bring more sunshine to the area with highs in the upper 80s to lower 90s. A sunny and hot stretch of weather is in the forecast for next work and school week with heat indices around 100 degrees through Thursday. [Click Here to Subscribe on YouTube:](https://www.youtube.com/@waff48news) Watch the latest WAFF 48 news, sports & weather videos on our YouTube channel! Copyright 2024 WAFF. All rights reserved.

author: KS Toronado
title: Hospital just called
text:
My 95 year old mom has been having some health issues lately. Hospital called just as I was leaving for my daily visit and said I better get up there, she might not last the night. Was healthy & active 3 weeks ago. All Democratic thoughts, prayers, vibes needed. She goes by Betty
I hope she is able to recover and be able to enjoy life unimpaired and in comfort.
Our prayers are with you and your family. My Sister, also named Betty, was transported by ambulance to a hospital in Frankfort, Kentucky yesterday. I am sure we are all connected in this world, however much we may believe we are independent.
Hugs for you

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Rather than peace, war ravages the land of Jesus' birth
text:
Summary by Ground News Rather than peace, war ravages the land of Jesus ' birth. As Christian nations celebrate the season of goodwill and peace, no one feels hypocritical in doing so. There are loud calls for Israel to stop the continuing fighting in Gaza. While not on the same scale as Israel, Hamas soldiers are still fighting. While Hamas continues fighting, so will Israel. title: Industrial Complex Proposal Threatens Some of the World's Clearest Skies for Astronomy

author: @telemundo52
title: Huelga en Boeing: trabajadores rechazan oferta de contrato y paralizan fábricas
text:
Trabajadores de montaje de aviones abandonaron sus puestos a primera hora de este viernes en fábricas de Boeing próximas a Seattle luego de los miembros del sindicado votaron abrumadoramente a favor de la huelga y rechazaron una oferta de contrato que habría elevado sus salarios un 25% en cuatro años.
La huelga comenzó a en la madrugada, menos de tres horas después de que la rama local de la Asociación Internacional de Maquinistas y Trabajadores Aeroespaciales dijo que el 94.6% de los trabajadores que votaron rechazaron el contrato, y que un 96% aprobaron la huelga, superando con facilidad el requisito de dos tercios favorables.
El paro afecta a 33,000 maquinistas de Boeing, en su mayoría en el estado de Washington, y se espera que paralice la producción de los aviones comerciales más vendidos del grupo. Aunque no afectará a los vuelos comerciales, supone otro revés para el gigante aeronáutico, cuya reputación y finanzas se han visto golpeadas este año por problemas de facturación y múltiples investigaciones federales.
nasa 24 Ago ¿Cuándo regresarán a la Tierra los dos astronautas varados en el espacio? Esto decidió la NASA estados unidos 20 Ago FAA ordena inspección de cientos de Boeing 787 tras incidente con avión de LATAM Los operarios en huelga montan el 737 Max, el más vendido de Boeing, además del 777 y del avión de carga 767, en las fábricas de Renton y Everett, en Washington. La protesta podría no paralizar la producción de los 787 Dreamliners, cuyo montaje corre a cargo de trabajadores no sindicados en Carolina del Sur.
Los maquinistas ganan una media de $75,608 al año, sin contar las horas extra, y con la oferta llegarían a los $106,350 al final del contrato de cuatro años, según Boeing.
Pero la propuesta estaba alejada de la petición inicial del sindicato de un alza del 40% en tres años. Además, se pidió el restablecimiento de las pensiones tradicionales suprimidas hace una década, pero aceptó un incremento de las contribuciones de Boeing a planes de pensiones de los empleados.
En el exterior de la fábrica de Renton, la gente se manifestó con carteles y bocinas, mientras sonaban canciones como “We’re Not Gonna Take It”, de Twisted Sister y “Look What You Made Me Do”, de Taylor Swift.
Boeing respondió afirmando que estaba “dispuesta a regresar a la mesa para alcanzar un nuevo acuerdo”.
“El mensaje fue claro: el acuerdo tentativo que alcanzamos con la dirección del sindicato no era aceptable para sus miembros. Seguimos comprometidos a restablecer nuestra relación con nuestros empleados y el sindicato”, dijo la compañía en un comunicado.
Muy pocas cosas le han salido bien a Boeing este año, desde la rotura de un panel que dejó un enorme agujero en uno de sus aviones comerciales en pleno vuelo en enero, a la decisión de la NASA de dejar dos astronautas en el espacio antes de que regresasen a la Tierra en una cápsula plagada de problemas fabricada por la compañía.
La huelga privará a Boeing de la vital liquidez que obtiene al entregar sus pedidos a las aerolíneas. Será un desafío más para el nuevo director general, Kelly Ortberg, quien hace seis semanas recibió el encargo de enderezar el rumbo de una firma que ha perdido más de $25,000 millones en los últimos seis años y ha quedado por detrás de su rival europeo, Airbus.
Ortberg hizo un esfuerzo de última hora para salvar un acuerdo que había sido respaldado de forma unánime por los negociadores sindicales. El miércoles, dijo a los maquinistas que “nadie gana” con un paro, y que una huelga pondría la recuperación de Boeing en peligro y plantearía más dudas sobre la empresa a ojos de sus clientes.
“Para Boeing, no es ningún secreto que nuestro negocio atraviesa un periodo difícil, en parte debido a nuestros propios errores en el pasado”, manifestó. “Trabajando junto, sé que podemos volver al buen camino, pero una huelga pondría en peligro nuestra recuperación compartida, erosionando más aún la confianza de nuestros clientes y perjudicando nuestra capacidad para determinar nuestro futuro juntos”.
Pero los trabajadores no tenían ganas de escuchar.
Holden apuntó que Ortberg tenía una posición complicada porque los maquinistas están resentidos por el estancamiento de los salarios y las concesiones que llevan realizando desde 2008 en pensiones y atención sanitaria para evitar que la empresa trasladase puestos de trabajo a otros lugares.
“Es difícil compensar 16 años”, dijo.
La votación fue también un revés para Holden y los negociadores sindicales, que habían recomendado dar el visto bueno a la oferta de contrato. Holden, quien predijo que la huelga saldría adelante, apuntó que la asociación hará una encuesta entre sus afiliados para decidir en qué cuestiones quieren hacer hincapié cuando se reanuden las negociaciones.

author: @16NewsNow
title: Notre Dame asks fans to wear green for national championship game
text:
Notre Dame asks fans to wear green for national championship game
SOUTH BEND, Ind. (WNDU) - If you’re a Notre Dame fan who is heading to Atlanta to watch the Irish football team play in the national championship game next week, you’re being told to pack green.
The university’s athletic department is asking fans to “Paint Atlanta Green” in support of the team.
It’s unclear at this time if this means the team will wear green jerseys for Monday’s championship matchup against the Ohio State Buckeyes.
Since Marcus Freeman has taken over as head coach, the Irish have worn green jerseys once a year for one of their home games.
They were wearing green when they last played Ohio State in 2023. That game ended in a heartbreaker for the Irish as the Buckeyes scored a game-winning touchdown in the game’s final seconds.
The team’s green jersey game this season was back on Sept. 28 against Louisville. The 16th-ranked Irish knocked off the 15th-ranked Cardinals 31-24.
Kickoff for Monday night’s national championship game between the Irish and the Buckeyes at Mercedes-Benz Stadium is set for 7:30 p.m. on EST.
